blind verb [T]
(DAMAGE SIGHT)
to make someone unable to see, permanently or for a short time: She was blinded in an accident at an early age. As I turned the corner the sun blinded me, so I didn't see the other car.

blind verb [T]
(CAUSE TO IGNORE)
to make someone unable to notice or understand something: We shouldn't let our prejudices blind us to the facts of the situation.
